summary:
Thomas Wesseling is an experienced Product Owner in the field of Mobile- and Conversational Apps. He has worked in the IT/Consultancy industry for more than two decades in different roles such as business analyst, manager consultant and product owner.

During his career Thomas has developed a great passion for IT Innovation mainly focusing on Conversational & Mobile technologies in the Business to Enterprise and Consumer markets while working with several Fortune 500 companies in the United States and Europe.

Thomas has excellent problem-solving skills, a dedication to customer service and a strong focus on team building. These skills have not only enabled him to deliver what has been promised but more importantly to keep an eye on the practical impact of innovations.

Specialties: 
- Customer Interaction Platforms
- Live / A-Sync Chat 
- Co-Browsing
- Intelligent Bots
- Mobile Apps and Websites
- Mobile Apps Eco Systems
- Customer Facing (Mobile) Apps
- Customer Experience Insights
- Usability
- Digital Transformation
- Content Management Strategy

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

certifications.name: Professional Scrum with User Experience I

projects.title: Optimalisation Mortgages Processes (Optimalisatie Hypotheek Keten – OHK)
projects.description: ABN Amro program focussing on the rationalization of the mortgage products, the introduction of new mortgage applications for ABN AMRO customers and the rationalization of the IT mortgage applications and subsidiaries.

profile_positions.description:
The Volksbank is the driving force behind ASN Bank, BLG Wonen, RegioBank and SNS, forming together the fourth-largest bank in the Netherlands. Their mission is: banking with a human touch meaning that they like to keep the products understandable for their customers. 

As Manager Consultant Mr. Wesseling has been working with the Retail DevOps teams on a proper foundation for consumer apps in the value stream Customer Advisory Relationship. He has also helped with the PI planning, roadmap, requirements and releasing several feature updates for the  Store Finder, Mortgage Calculator and Customer Appointment form.
profile_positions.title: Manager Consultant de Volksbank

profile_positions.description:
Rabobank is a cooperative bank. There are more than a hundred local Rabobanks in the Netherlands, which each operate with a high degree of independence so they can better serve their customers and local communities. Rabobank also has sizeable international banking operations. They focus on international business and rural activities in general and on the Food and Agri sector in particular.

As Product Owner Mr. Wesseling was responsible for the conversational roadmap covering the Chat, Virtual Assistant-, and Voice Assistant channels. His team has been scaling up a New Chat application including Virtual Assistant (Chatbot) for all retail banking customers. After the Covid-19 outbreak it was very much needed to reduce the amount of calls for the customer service teams. The Virtual Assistant now handles most of the repetitive questions so that the Rabobank advisors can spend more time on the more complicated matters and improving customer service.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Chat and Virtual Assistant Rabobank

profile_positions.description:
The NOMI contact app is being developed as a national platform for children who have cancer to communicate with each other. Development is done in close cooperation with the KiKa foundation, Sogeti and the Princess Máxima Center for Pediatric Oncology. This is a new hospital in the Netherlands where children with cancer are being treated by various specialists working closely together. 

As a Product Owner Mr Wesseling has been responsible for managing and prioritizing the backlog for the NOMI app. Within 1,5 months the development team has delivered a working minimal lovable product and several demo’s. This has allowed us to proceed with the next goals of starting the internal testing phase and preparing for a pilot in Q2 2019.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Apps Kika

profile_positions.description:
Air France KLM Martinair Cargo is the specialized air cargo business of the Air France KLM Group. Together with stakeholders from Commercial and Operations Mr Wesseling has identified the most important customer- and employee pains and mapping those in a customer journey for Import Cargo. 

Based on the customer journey research, Mr Wesseling has delivered a service blueprint model covering future needs of cargo employees and customers. This has allowed the Program Management to identify epics for the next Program Increments. These epics among others included important features for the digitalisation roadmap and becoming more competitive on a short term.
profile_positions.title: Manager Consultant KLM Cargo

profile_positions.description:
Florius is the biggest mortgage label of ABN Amro and a digital front runner in the Dutch mortgage market.

As a Product Owner Mr Wesseling has been responsible for the implementation roadmap of digital channels such as the mijnFlorius- and Florius Adviseurs Netwerk apps. From January 2016 onwards his team has developed two mobile apps facilitating consumers and advisors with a broad set of online services. Both apps are available in the Dutch Apple Appstore, Google Playstore and contribute to higher NPS scores for Florius. While working on new releases the team has been carefully balancing between improvements based on customer feedback, innovations in the mobile eco-systems and regulation requirements (such as the GDPR).
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Apps Florius

profile_positions.description:
ABN Amro Hypotheken offers mortgage products through various channels and distributed under various brands including Florius and MoneYou.

As Lead Consultant Mr. Wesseling has been working together with the Channels team on defining the cross-channel strategy for several mortgage labels and the right mobile development capabilities for the software factory and design teams.  Based on the strategy ABN AMRO is able to shorten the time-to-market for new products and services with a focus on the best user experience and product quality. This is important for ABN's ambitions to stay relevant in a.o the mortgage market.
profile_positions.title: Lead Consultant Mobile ABN AMRO

profile_positions.description:
Mr. Wesseling has been involved as Consultant/Architect with the implementation of customer websites in Microsoft Azure. These responsive websites were based on the Tridion 2013 Content Management Systeem and have connections with external systems for tracking and tracing, store finders and e-commerce. 

The new websites are ready for the mobile consumer supporting smartphone-, tablet- and desktop browsers on a variety of screen sizes.
profile_positions.title: Lead Consultant Cloud & Mobile Sogeti

profile_positions.description:
Abbott Nutrition is a division of Abbott, the global, broad-based health care company. 

For Abbott's Interactive Marketing department Mr. Wesseling has worked on several multi-channel projects with on- and offshore teams. During theses projects he has utilized social media, mobile web, mobile apps, commerce platforms, community software and learning management systems to reach and engage online customers.
profile_positions.title: Manager Consultant Abbott Nutrition

profile_positions.description:
Abercrombie & Fitch is a leading specialty clothing retailer holding four unique lifestyle brands - Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister Co., and Gilly Hicks.

To support the growth of the e-commerce business and new store openings in Europe and Asia Mr. Wesseling has worked on extending and enhancing A&F’s supply chain reverse logistics process. During this project he has coordinated and planned meetings with IT- and Business representatives to review requirements, process flows, test planning, functional/technical designs and cutover schedules.
profile_positions.title: Manager Consultant Abercrombie & Fitch

profile_positions.description:
The Ministry of the Interior and Kingdom Relations (BZK) is one of the eleven ministries of Dutch central government. 

As a Solution Consultant Mr. Wesseling supported and managed the implementation of a new collaboration platform for government workers as part of the program called Digital Workspace Dutch Government (DWR). In 2010 the collaboration platform was the first one of all DWR projects to "go live" for a group of 10.000 end users representing 8 different government departments. This is an important step towards a more centralized and lean government organization.
profile_positions.title: Lead Consultant New Government Workspace MinBZK

profile_positions.description:
Sogeti brings together more than 20 000 professionals in 15 countries and has a strong local presence in over 100 locations in Europe, USA and India. Sogeti is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Cap Gemini S.A., listed on the Paris Stock Exchange. 

As a Solution Architect Mr. Wesseling was responsible for knowledge sharing and technical leadership on unified communications and collaborations solutions. As Sogeti we have established the Microsoft Gold partnership by implementing a Unified Communications and Collaboration experience centre (utlilzing the complete Microsoft s product stack) in Sogeti's HQ while working together with a team of infrastructure and innovation specialists in the Netherlands, Sweden and India. Thomas has lead this team of infrastructure and innovation specialists.
profile_positions.title: Solution Architect Unified Communications Sogeti

profile_positions.description:
Detailresult Groep NV includes 280+ successful shops in the Netherlands. These shops are among others supermarkets DekaMarkt and Dirk but also liquor store Dirck III and pharmacy Dirx. 

Mr. Wesseling supported the implementation of a mobile stock management application used by retail staff to scan and order products in the supermarkets. He was responsible for the functional and technical design documentation, functionality workshops, piloting the application and solution roll out. Customer benefits includes: stock reduction, higher productivity, quicker overview in turnover per product, reduction of paper forms and improvement of working conditions for the staff.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Mobile Solutions Detailresult

profile_positions.description:
Sogeti is a leading provider of technology and software testing, specializing in Application, Infrastructure and Engineering Services. Sogeti offers solutions around Testing, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Mobile, Cloud and Cyber Security, combining world class methodologies and its global delivery model, Rightshore®.

Mr. Wesseling was responsible for solution development and knowledge sharing on mobile solutions based on the Oracle technology stack. He has managed the Oracle partnership by demonstrating Sogeti’s competitive capabilities in the market. This was a huge enabler for achieving the Oracle Certified Advantage Partner level.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer Sogeti Nederland

profile_positions.description:
Nationale Nederlanden is an insurance and investment management company active in more than 18 countries, with a strong presence in a number of European countries 

For the insurance department (formerly part of ING the Netherlands) Mr. Wesseling was responsible for automating quotation output towards the bank’s customers using a Document Output Model Manager (DOMM) solution. The DOMM team acts as an intermediary between the Insurance Business and the Service Center Documents Services. The quotation documents and output now have a standard lay out, reuse legal texts and business logic. Utilizing the DOMM reduces errors, enables a short time to market and consistent lay out for all insurance products.
profile_positions.title: Business System Analyst Nationale Nederlanden/ING

profile_positions.description:
GSU is part of the Eneco organization and services electronic heaters and boilers. 

For the field engineers Mr. Wesseling has delivered a mobile field service application. Using this mobile application the productivity of the engineers has improved tremendously. GSU can reach a higher service level and reduce the number of paper forms used in the field service process.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Mobile Solutions GSU/Eneco

profile_positions.description:
PCM Media is the ad sales company of the Netherland's best newspapers and their websites. These are the quality news papers such as NRC Handelsblad, Trouw en De Volkskrant. 

Mr. Wesseling has been responsible for testing the SDS (Smart Desktop Services) supported by Citrix technology and a new Ad Creation system. He has used an exploratory testing strategy to enable a short time to market for both the SDS solution and the Ad Creation system.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Quality Assurance PCM Media

profile_positions.description:
Inholland University of Applied Sciences is an educational institution with over 32,000 students, 26 research groups, more than 110 nationalities, and approximately 2500 employees.

InHolland has implemented Microsoft Exchange as a replacement of Novell GroupWise. Mr Wesseling was responsible for the identification, migration, installation and configuration of all mobile Personal Digital Assistants devices within the InHolland organization at various locations. During the migration process, Mr. Wesseling has helped 100+ users with a smooth migration of all their calendar data on the PDA device. All users are able to successfully synchronize their mobile devices with the new Microsoft Exchange environments.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Mobile Solutions Inholland University

profile_positions.description:
IT-Source offers IT solutions (websites, hosting etc.) for small business companies. In 2008 IT-source has been acquisited by Peak-IT. 

As a part-time web developer Mr. Wesseling has developed websites based on Flash and HTML for small business customers.
profile_positions.title: Web Developer (parttime)

profile_positions.description:
Finalist is an Authorized Java Center specialized in technical consulting and development of applications based on Java technology for companies like Vodafone, ABN AMRO, ING Group etc. 

As an intern/trainee Mr. Wesseling has written a strategic and technical paper about the Wireless Application Protocol and mobile applications in general. During this assignment Mr. Wesseling has gained knowledge on mobile web technologies by writing an agenda application based on WML and JSP, testing Nokia Mobile Gateway software and using the first mobile internet devices available on the market.
profile_positions.title: Web Developer (internship)

volunteer_experiences.description:
SogetiLabs gathers distinguished technology leaders from around the Sogeti world. It is an initiative explaining not how IT works, but what IT means for business. The past decade has seen a fundamental shift in the axis of IT innovation, from technological innovation to business innovation. Previously, new IT systems were introduced at the high end of the economic spectrum by government and enterprise investment, before trickling down to small and medium businesses, the home office and ultimately consumers.

During my career I have experienced the rise of the Mobile (IT) industry and in particular the shift in the demand for Enterprise to Consumer mobile applications. I haven been helping Sogeti clients with innovating their mobile business. More often this has been part of a Digital Transformation program. Through the Sogeti Labs network I have shared and contribute on these topics.

- - Publications - -
- Conversational AI and Bots -
https://labs.sogeti.com/focus-areas-for-enhancing-live-chat-and-scaling-up-with-bots-part-1/
https://labs.sogeti.com/focus-areas-for-enhancing-live-chat-and-scaling-up-with-bots-part-2/
https://labs.sogeti.com/focus-areas-for-enhancing-live-chat-and-scaling-up-with-bots-part-3/

- Customer Experience Insights -
https://labs.sogeti.com/latest-insights-on-customer-experience-management/

- Mobile Apps -
https://labs.sogeti.com/improve-your-mobile-apps-3/
https://labs.sogeti.com/improve-your-mobile-apps-2/
https://labs.sogeti.com/improve-your-mobile-apps-1/
https://labs.sogeti.com/how-to-improve-your-apps/

- CSR -
https://labs.sogeti.com/my-journey-in-corporate-social-responsibility/

More than 2,300 companies participated in the 2017 exhibition, which spanned nine halls and eleven outdoor spaces. Everything from connected cars, virtual reality, new handsets and ingenious app ideas, to 3D printing, privacy protection and backend solutions were on display. The conference programme was a highlight of the week featuring 322 speakers from consumer brands, mobile organisations, mobile operators and industries touched by the mobile market — including automotive, advertising, banking, health, NGOs, entertainment and education. 

Together with professionals from 208 countries and territories, I was one of the visitors of the Mobile World Congress (representing Sogeti/Cap Gemini). I was joining several keynotes and conference sessions like the one with Reed Hastings, Founder and CEO of Netflix discussing how content is in the midst of a period of disruption and change. Most of my experiences have been shared in the form of blog posts on the SogetiLabs website. 

- - Publications - -
https://labs.sogeti.com/driverless-cars-ultimate-use-case-telecom-industry/
https://labs.sogeti.com/emerging-evolving-trends-telecom-industry/

Appsterdam's goal is to bring app makers together, and their mission is to support their interests worldwide. Amsterdam is the capital of Appsterdam - the world capital of apps - to establish a centre of gravity for the app industry, to provide a place where all app makers can gather, and to create a framework for people to give back and support the community. 

I have joined several Meetups to give (and get) inspiration to (and from) consultants working in the industry.

volunteer_experiences.role: Donating for the CMA 20th Century Design Market in 2012
volunteer_experiences.description:
The 20th Century Design Market was a 3-day event showcasing vintage decorative and fine arts from all design movements of the 20th Century including furniture, lighting, sculptures, painting, jewelry, photography and more. 

Donating for this and other CMA events was a great way for the Museum to support the work and mission in creating experiences with great art for everyone.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of Central Ohio Cloud Computing User Group
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Central Ohio Cloud Computing User Group is a monthly meeting to discuss many aspects of cloud computing. The group is a community driven group which will discuss a wide range of ideas, problems, solutions, and technologies which compromise cloud computing. 

I have joined several Meetups to give (and get) inspiration to (and from) consultants working in the industry.

The Wireless Leiden Foundation (http://www.wirelessleiden.nl/) builds a public wireless network with coverage all over the city of Leiden, a moderate sized town in the west of the Netherlands, based on open source standards and Wirelss Local Area Network technologies. 

I was joining the Wireless Leiden initiative as a volunteer and helped the foundation with the implementation of the Wi-Fi/ WLAN Infrastructure and a new website based on Drupal CMS.
